description: Partial sums of digits of decimal expansion of Pi.
comments: a(n) = A007953(A011545(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 30 2003The partial sums to 10^k, k>=0: 4, 44, 480, 4479, 44897, 449336, 4499937, 45002885, 449989731, .... - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 16 2007If the sequence were to start with an initial term a(0) = 0, its first differences would reproduce the complete sequence of digits of Pi. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 19 2015
links: Mital Ashok, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..999
mathematica: Rest@ FoldList[ Plus, 0, First@ RealDigits[Pi, 10, 58]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 16 2007 *)Accumulate[RealDigits[Pi,10,60][[1]]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 11 2013 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
